Name: Head of Akhenaten Wearing Blue Crown
Description: The head of a statue of King Akhenaten depicts him wearing the Blue Crown, which evolved from a military headdress. The Blue Crown became part of the classic imagery associated with the king's ceremonies.The crown is decorated with a uraeus, or royal cobra, the symbol of kingship. The coils of the uraeus form a circle above the king's forehead and then extend over the top of the headdress. The head is carved in the style of the earlier Amarna art.
